Cardiac Cycle

 The cardiac cycle is the rhythmic muscular contractions of the heart through systole and diastole of both the atria nad ventricles.
 Each phase of the cycle can be represented by waves on an electrocardiogram and consists of seven distinct phases:

 1. Atrial contraction
 2. Isovolumetric contraction
 3. Rapid ejection
 4. Reduced ejection
 5. Isovolumetric relaxation
 6. Rapid filling
 7. Reduced filling
